alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin; Sherburne; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 4:40PM CDT until May 09 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Hennepin County in east central Minnesota... Northeastern Wright County in central Minnesota... Northwestern Anoka County in east central Minnesota... Southeastern Sherburne County in central Minnesota... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 440 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Rogers, or 17 miles east of Buffalo, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Champlin around 445 PM CDT. Coon Rapids, Ramsey and Anoka around 450 PM CDT. Andover around 455 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include East Bethel. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and east central Minnesota. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and east central Minnesota.
